methods.getBooleanColumnHolder:
Create a column holder for a Boolean column where the calues are represented as bytes.
 The given byte array will be converted to a Boolean array.

:param name: (java.lang.String) - column name
:param grouped: (boolean) - true if the column is grouped; false otherwise
:param data: (byte...) - column data (byte values where 1 represents true, 0 represents false, and null otherwise)
:return: (io.deephaven.db.v2.utils.ColumnHolder) a Boolean column holder
methods.getColumnHolderFromArray:
Create a column holder from an array object, inferring the data type from the given array object.

:param name: (java.lang.String) - column name
:param grouped: (boolean) - true if the column is grouped; false otherwise
:param data: (java.lang.Object) - an object holding the column data (must be an array)
:return: (io.deephaven.db.v2.utils.ColumnHolder) a column holder with a type matching the component type of the provided array
methods.getColumnSource:
Gets a column source for the data. Other than the special case of DBDateTime columns, this requires
 that the type specified match the component type of the actual data.

:return: (io.deephaven.db.v2.sources.ColumnSource) column source constructed with data from this column holder
methods.getDateTimeColumnHolder:
Create a column holder for a DateTime column where the values are represented as longs.
 Whatever process produces a table from this column holder should respect this and create the appropriate type
 of ColumnSource. Under normal conditions, this will be a DateTimeArraySource (see ColumnHolder.getColumnSource()).

:param name: (java.lang.String) - column name
:param grouped: (boolean) - true if the column is grouped; false otherwise
:param data: (long...) - column data (long integers representing nanos since the epoch)
:return: (io.deephaven.db.v2.utils.ColumnHolder) a DBDateTime column holder implemented with longs for storage

text: Data to construct a data column.
